notesStmt.note: Imperfect at the beginning and at the end. Leaves missing after folios 8 and 87. Folios 1, 2, 15, 53, 54, 62, 65, 71, 76, 79, 80, 88, 90, 91 are damaged. Greater part of folio 87 is lost. Many folios worm-eaten.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: An Arabic commentary on the book of Proverbs.

collation.p: 10 quires, nos. 2-10, and folios 88-95, the numeration of which is uncertain. Nos. 2, 10 and the last one are imperfect. Signatures in Arabic words on the upper margin of the first folio, and the four following folios are numbered with Arabic numerals.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Hebrew square and Arabic Naskhi script of approximately 14th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine title: 'Comm. on Proverbs. Arabic. Brit. Mus. Or. 2567.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), a antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 08 July 1882, folio [96v].
